column4: can anyone help with getting my network card working?  i can't get online at all in ubuntu.  the card is a via rhine ii.
does the card appear in ifconfig -a ?
yes, i think so.  it shows up in the network settings as well as eth0, but no connection.
do the LEDs on the NIC glow or blink?
hmm...it's in a laptop, no LEDs.  the card worked on the breezy livecd, and works now in windows.
Hm ok... can you manually configure an IP address?
i'm afraid i don't know how.  another problem is i've only got this one computer, so trying anything will require rebooting. :|
Uhm that's not very comfortable to debug :(
for the how: open a terminal, run sudo su and then ifconfig <iface> <ip>
iface is eth0 or whatever interface your NIC is, and IP is a free IP
And then you can try to ping your default gw. with 'ping <defaultgwip>
do you know your default GW's IP?
you'd better make sure it is, because if it's not you won't get any ping replys anyway
alright.  many thanks...i think i'll write this down and try it out, but then i'd better try to get on irc from another computer.
